chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: AweMUD uses the standard GNU method of building and installating applications, ./configure && make && make install.
chapter.screen: tar -zxf awemud-0.25.tar.gz cd awemud-0.25.tar.gz ./configure && make && make install

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: AweMUD depends on a single external library, Boehm-Demers-Weiser Garbage Collector. This library must be installed in order to build AweMUD. The BDW libgc uses the standard build and install commands. However, AweMUD requires that libgc be built with C++, which can be done by passing the --enable-cplusplus switch to the ./configure script.
section.screen: tar -zxf gc6.6.tar.gz cd gc6.6 ./configure --enable-cpluplus && make && make install
section.para: If you plan on hacking on the AweMUD source code, you will also need all of the following utilities. You will not need these utilities if you only want to build and install AweMUD.
If you want to build the AweMUD Manual (this document), you will also need xmlto.
All of the above software is generally available for Linux, BSD, and Cygwin.
